intro: Aralia quinduensis, commonly known as the Quindu aralia, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It is characterized by its compound leaves, which are typically palmately arranged and have a feathery appearance. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels, typical of the Araliaceae family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
